title: Junit should be an osgi bundle
body:
I sometimes use junit assertions even in production code to make sure no invalid data slips through. As some of my applications run under osgi it would be very handy if junit already was a valid osgi bundle. 

As far as I can tell it would only be necessary to switch the to packaging in the pom to bundle and add the maven bundle pllugin. I can provide a patch if that helps.

Christian

title: Full support for automatic upload of maven artifacts
body: I'm using the pull request framework to provide a place to hang community discussion of this change.  Kent, your feedback is welcome, but not necessarily needed unless maven and ant automation seem interesting.

title: How can I create a test suite to the test method level?
Intersecting filters
body:
Fixes issue #39, by having multiple calls to ParentRunner.filter result in the intersection of filters, rather than just the last one used.

(Submitted for review)

title: Assertions for Number greater-than or less-than
body:
Although BigDecimal.equals() has already been raised, in boundary case testing with numbers, you will always need greater-than and less-than checks.
I have already written an extension for myself (including test cases for it) that gives: assertGreaterThan(Number reference, Number actual) and assertLessThan(Number reference, Number actual).
My personal extesion also includes support for "numerically equal" asserts, though I am aware this has already been discussed and effectively rejected.
If you agree that this would be useful as a part of JUnit, then I will happily commit the changes (with or without "numerically equal" asserts).
Note: Current solution does not allow comparison of two different types of Number, though from the human viewpoint, this would make perfect sense.

title: creating temporary tree folders
@Ignored tests are not reported
body:
tests marked as @Ignore are not reported at all. in a class containing 6 tests (one of which ignored), I get this verbose output: 
    [junit] junit.framework.TestListener: tests to run: 6
    [junit] junit.framework.TestListener: startTest(testCanFindTestDir)
    [junit] junit.framework.TestListener: endTest(testCanFindTestDir)
    [junit] junit.framework.TestListener: startTest(testCanFindTestDirWithSlash)
    [junit] junit.framework.TestListener: endTest(testCanFindTestDirWithSlash)
    [junit] junit.framework.TestListener: startTest(testBasicPaths)
    [junit] junit.framework.TestListener: endTest(testBasicPaths)
    [junit] junit.framework.TestListener: startTest(testPathsCaseSentive)
    [junit] junit.framework.TestListener: endTest(testPathsCaseSentive)
    [junit] junit.framework.TestListener: startTest(testGetCaseSubPath)
    [junit] junit.framework.TestListener: endTest(testGetCaseSubPath)
    [junit] Implicitly adding /usr/share/ant/lib/junit.jar:/usr/share/java/ant-launcher-1.8.0.jar:/usr/share/ant/lib/ant.jar:/usr/share/ant/lib/ant-junit.jar to CLASSPATH
the ignored test is counted in the 6, but further not mentioned. in the xml report I get this: 
  <testcase classname="test.nl.nelen_schuurmans.io.TestFileFunctions" name="testCanFindTestDir" time=
"0.018" />
  <testcase classname="test.nl.nelen_schuurmans.io.TestFileFunctions" name="testCanFindTestDirWithSla
sh" time="0.002" />
  <testcase classname="test.nl.nelen_schuurmans.io.TestFileFunctions" name="testBasicPaths" time="0.0
02" />
  <testcase classname="test.nl.nelen_schuurmans.io.TestFileFunctions" name="testPathsCaseSentive" tim
e="0.004" />
  <testcase classname="test.nl.nelen_schuurmans.io.TestFileFunctions" name="testGetCaseSubPath" time="0.016" />
while I would expect also this: 
  <testcase classname="test.nl.nelen_schuurmans.io.TestFileFunctions" name="testCanFindSambaShare" time="0.016">
    <skipped/>
  </testcase>
not getting ignored tests in the reports makes the reports less informative.

title: Assert.assertArrayEquals(float[], float[], float) reports failures as doubles
Method DataPoints does not honor ParameterSignature
fixed issue 220 with signature filtering DataPoints method
body: Patch to support multiple-data-types / parameter-signatures in @DataPoints methods.

title: [Enhancement] @Example annotation for examples
Show parameter values for parametrized tests
Fixes ParentRunner.filter, as reported in issue #38
error count not initialized in junit.tests.framework.TestListenerTest
body:
I noticed that the variable fErrorCount in junit.tests.framework.TestListenerTest does not get initialized.

I have version 4.9

title: error using JUnit4TestAdapter with class which has no test methods
ParentRunner now assumes that getChildren() returns a modifiable list
body:
As of commit 01b427b3b89ce04d01f0, ParentRunner now assumes that getChildren() returns a  modifiable list. Previously, the sorting and the filtering happened in a list that was a copy of the List returned by getChildren()

Less of an issue, but the call to Filter.intersect() in ParentRunner.filter() is probably not needed, since when the first filter was applied, the items not matching the filter were removed.

title: Assertions for Comparable
body: assertGreaterThan and assertLessThan added

title: Provide test name to @Before method
TemporaryFolder takes a root folder in the constructor
ErrorCollector.checkThat with reason
body:
Hi, 

i think the ErrorCollector should have an overload of the checkThat Method, that takes a reason (as String) as first parameter, as the Assert.assertThat does.

title: ErrorCollector.checkThat overload
body:
Please pull my patch to the ErrorCollector.
See Issue https://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues/231

title: ErrorCollector.checkThat overload
body: Please include this checkThat overload, to be able to include a reason to the assertion

title: 4.7 release notes inconsistent
body:
https://github.com/KentBeck/junit/commit/c618504adee4bc91b3bd7e0ff06be6e1fa9d88cc#commitcomment-403453

Copy of my commit comment text:

This change has also to be done in the 4.7 HTML release notes. I've read these release notes couple of weeks ago in text form and found sadly that Hamcrest was downgraded again. Then I've read the release notes again today in html and wondered that I don't see the spot again about downgrading Hamcrest.

title: Prevent either().and() and both().or()
Update ParentRunner to make a copy of the List returned by getChildren()
body: Fixes issue #227

title: Optimize ParentRunner.filter for nested suites
body: Prior to this change, applying a filter to a nested suite would create redundant nested filters (for each suite or test class, ParentRunner.filter() called Filter.intersect() again)

title: Optimize Filter.intersect() for common cases
body:
- ALL.intersect(filter)
- filter.intersect(ALL)
- filter.intersect(filter)

title: Misleading error
